intro: Brachystegia velutina, commonly known as the velvet brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical rainforests of Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The tree is known for its dense, velvety bark, which gives it its common name and provides protection against pests and environmental stress. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat by supporting diverse wildlife and contributing to soil fertility through nitrogen fixation.
